intro: Echinocactus setispinus f. mierensis, commonly known as the Mierensis Echinocactus, is a rare and unique variant of the Echinocactus genus. It is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that are typically green with a bluish tint. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers during the summer months, which are clustered at the tips of the stems. It is native to a limited geographic region in northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
